# Flattening the State Monad: A Vector-Space Interpretation

This repository contains the full formalisation and supporting materials for the paper:

> **"Flattening the State Monad via Idempotent Projection in Vector Spaces"** > ‚àé All proofs are verified in **Lean 4** using `mathlib4`
>
> ‚àé Formal DSL application structure for **ETC** and **Kairos√© DSL** > ‚àé Research focus: **Monadic collapse ‚âà geometric projection**

## üìö Abstract

We present a vector-space semantics for the state monad $T_S(X) = S \\to (X \\times S)$ that flattens nested layers of state into a linear form. The central construction interprets the monadic multiplication

$$
\\mu : T_S T_S(X) \\to T_S(X)
$$

as an **idempotent projection** $P : V \\to V$ such that $P^2 = P$, via a functor

$$
F : \\text{Kleis}(T_S) \\to \\text{Vect}_{\mathbb{R}}
$$

that maps computations to real vector spaces.

## üßÆ Core Contributions

1. Defines a functor $F$ from the Kleisli category to $\\text{Vect}_{\mathbb{R}}$

2. Constructs a concrete linear map $P$ realizing monadic flattening

3. Machine-checks the identity $P^2 = P$ in Lean 4

4. Connects the result to Kairos√© DSL and GPT tensor collapse

## üõ† Build Instructions

### Requirements

* Lean 4 (v4.2 or later)

* `lake` build system

I‚Äôve been exploring a potential generalization that I‚Äôd appreciate your input on.

Instead of treating a matrix A : V ‚Üí V as an operator on vectors,

what if we interpret it as deforming the entire ambient space in which vectors reside?

That is, under a functorial view:

T(X) = \text{‚Äúspace where } X \text{ lives is geometrically twisted by some effect‚Äù}

Then:

  • Œ∑_X embeds X into a deformed context
  • Œº_X collapses nested ambient deformations
  • The identity Œº = œÄ becomes the collapse of geometric nesting into a single semantic effect

This seems to extend monadic reasoning to linear algebraic structures ‚Äî

not just state monads, but any context where operators act on ambient geometries (e.g., SVD, projections, eigen decompositions).

My questions:

  1. Has this kind of space-centric monad interpretation been formally explored?
  2. Would this require a shift toward enriched categories or structured fibrations?
  3. How might one formalize such monads as ‚Äúambient deformation functors‚Äù on Vect or similar?

Any pointers, references, or counterexamples would be greatly appreciated ‚Äî

thank you again for the discussion and insights so far.

‚Äì J.
